page.title: 09Blackbird Inn Ponteland
page.content: This incorporates the remains of the tower castle of Ponteland,built by Roger Bertram(1150-90).It was destroyed by the Earl of Douglas as he retreated with his army of Scots,after his attempt to take Newcastle upon Tyne which was thwarted by Harry Hotspur in 1388.It remained in ruins for 200 years,and was rebuilt as a manor house by Mark Errington.It stayed in this catholic family's hands until 1774.Despite having their lands confiscated during the Civil War they later had them returned.The supposed ghost dates from the Erringtons time when a son committed suicide.It was turned into an inn a century later. The name originates from the billeting of foreign mercenaries known to the locals as Blackbergers.Every New Years day a wheelbarrow race is held at the Inn.
